questions.neutral: Did you time it well - calm right now?

hobby.message: Origami help keep the noise out?
Urban exploring with that homebrew again?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me - In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: Calm? Sure, if you don't count the buzz in the air.
Just here to enjoy the drink, you know?
Some folks wander streets, I wander below — old places, sealed up.
Crowded tech's been watching — makes the alleys exciting.
Risk's part of it — not for everyone's taste, I'd say.
Calm feels so rare lately with the protests, doesn't it?
Needed a break from the usual — lingering spots underground.
Exploration is my thing, especially tunnel runs, when they're quiet.
The drones' hum pushes me back — better to rest here.
My hobby? Not your everyday stroll, really.
It's that kind of night, calm does seem rare these days.
I'm one for exploring tunnels, best spots are usually quiet — usually.
City's got hidden gems underground, sealed places waiting to be seen.
Protests stirred things, even underground's not what it was.
Missed a dive earlier — had to reroute with all the eyes above.
Calm times are a pearl under all this pressure, I'd say.
I've got a knack for wandering utility tunnels, places folks forgot.
Underground's a curious place — keeps me grounded amidst all chaos.
Drones made me miss a good exploration today, too many eyes around.
After a few drinks, the city's hidden paths call me down again.
You know, I don't mind a quiet moment amidst the chaos recently.
My hobby? Lost worlds below — exploring tunnels under the radar.
I've been at it for ages; keeps me sane in a tech-covered city.
Can't beat the feel of old metal and concrete, tells a tale or two.
Drones messed with today's plan — too keen on my trail, had to skip it.
hobby_answer: Can't say it ever gets boring. It's a pretty neat thing, you know.
Adventures get weird with the city on edge, though.
Some tunnels feel less safe with hovering eyes around.
The whole Halden business makes one cautious.
Guess it's best to keep it under wraps for now.
Do I get bored? Not quite, my friend.
But those sealed-off areas are drawing more attention lately.
City changes its face with all the tech, especially post-leak.
Let's just say I'm more watched than I'd like these days.
Halden left quite a riddle behind, didn't he?
Boring? Hardly with the way the city likes to keep secrets!
But the leak's got eyes everywhere, you notice?
Drone patrols sure dampen exploration, you know.
Noticed more metal buzz lately, since Halden's incident.
Feels like I've got company I didn't invite these days.
Boring? Nah, unless you call dodging drones exciting.
With the BCI syncing again, it's making sneaking around trickier, you know?
Seems like every tunnel now has mechanical eyes tracking your every step.
Halden's death, the leak – it's just stirred the whole hornet's nest.
Even my brews aren't getting their usual rounds in the tunnels.
Boring? Never, especially when you see Stenograd's underbelly!
But the leak, Halden's death – it's like the city's throwing curveballs at my explorations.
The Harmonists slowing down expansion grounded me this week — drones all over!
Got a face-to-face with surveillance the other day — first in a long while.
Strange out there without Halden's hand guiding the system. Makes you rethink your steps.
